sn56.23:1.2: “Mendicants, there are these four noble truths.
sn56.23:1.4: The noble truths of suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
sn56.23:1.5: These are the four noble truths.
sn56.23:1.6: It is because he has truly woken up to these four noble truths that the Realized One is called ‘the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha’.
sn56.23:2.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
